I think than 3 Bc4 is the best option. This move puts pressure over a2-g8 diagonal (d5 and f7, specially) 3 ... Qh4+ is answered with Kf1 and the queen can take f4 with check (and e4, too), but I believe than that capture gives to the white tempos and attack by the open lanes. Obviously, 3 Nf3 is a good alternative (I played this move in several games in this mini-tournament, and I comment my game with jimmysaylor with this move). May be 3 Qf3, adding pressure in d5 and f7, is a playable move.

Black attacks the f-pawn, but it's so early for move the queen and now, the black queen can be a good target for the white pieces. I offer now a pawn for development, but, for example, white can play without fear 4 fxe5 Qh5+ 5 Kf1 Qxe4 6 d3 Qxe5 7 Nf3 and, now, the e-column is open and white has big advantage in development. Of course, black has another alternatives for her fifth move. Black must create a plan with the move d5, freeing the bishops!
I prefer this development, attacking the weak square d5. I see, in several games of the tournament, the move f5; but 4 ... Qh4+ 5 Kf1 Qxe4 is threating bishop and f-pawn.

This move is risky. Now, white can threat the queen with d3, but Qh4+ and Qd8. With 5. d4 the situation isn't equal, white looks better. But, I choice the next move for castle quickly and attack f7, where I seek the Achilles' foot.
Again, white had alternatives with d3 and d4. I choice protect h4, castle and, later, play in the center. May be, this plan isn't the better, but is sure.
Better is 5.... Nf6, acting over d5.
Now, I castled. But, d4 is an alternative, again.
6 ... Nf6 or 6 Be6, may be.
Ok, with both knights in the fight, and the LSB and the rook looking for f7, white has decisive advantage. The move 7 d4 opens the center.
Black hasn't good alternatives. 7 ... Qg4 8 Bxf7+ and if 8 ... Kxf7 9 Nxe5 double check.
8 Ng5 works, too.
Again, black hasn't good alternatives. 8 ... Qe6 9 Nc7+
My first think was 9 Nxe7 Nxe7 10 Bxf7+ winning with the previous threat. But 9 ... Kxe7 is an alternative and white, still winning, has more work.
I think than Kd8 was better. Now, white can destroy the kingside, keeping the material and positional advantage.

Black hasn't real choices, now. 10 ... Qg4 11 Bh5 Qxh5 12 Nxe5+ Nf6 13 Qxh5 and white has two mate threats f7 and e8. If 13 ... g6 14 Bh6+ Kg8 15 Nxg6 Nc6 16 Nxe7+ Nxe7 17 Qe8+ Nxe8 18 Rf8++ Beautiful mate.
Black loses the queen.
Black loses the queen.
12 ... Nf6 was better
12 ... Nf6 was better
12 ... Nf6 was better
I think in open the d-column for my rook. White will take the rook.
Now, I seek for 15 Nxa6 bxa6 16 Bxc5+ Ne7 and I didn't a way for the mate. Thus, I captured the rook
